definition: to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Yes, I miss pastoring, but am consistently being challenged at CCM.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我怀念牧养的工作，但我喜欢中信的挑战。

sentences.english: Woe be to the shepherds of Israel that do feed themselves!
sentences.chinese: 以色列的牧人只知牧养自己。

sentences.english: I was shepherded by an older sister for almost 2 years.
sentences.chinese: 我被一个年长的姊妹牧养了近两年。

sentences.english: Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead As in the days of old.
sentences.chinese: 求你让他们在巴和基列得著牧养，像古时一样。

sentences.english: Animal pastoral facilities security maintenance management.
sentences.chinese: 动物牧养设施安全维护管理。

sentences.english: Shaphat son of Adlai was in charge of the herds in the valleys.
sentences.chinese: 掌管山谷牧养牛群的是亚第赉的儿子沙法。

sentences.english: Now, this Good and Great Shepherd is looking for someone to shepherd His flock on His behalf.
sentences.chinese: 现在，这个又好又大的牧人寻找人来牧养他的羊群。

sentences.english: Ye eat the fat, and ye clothe you with the wool, ye kill them that are fed: but ye feed not the flock.
sentences.chinese: 你们吃脂油，穿羊毛，宰肥壮的，却不牧养群羊。

definition: to pray on behalf of sb
the will of Heaven/the will of God
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
